description: Function: Unwinds double-stranded DNA during replication and repair; Role in LAB: Facilitates DNA replication and genome stability, supporting growth and survival; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Ensures LAB maintain genetic integrity under stress, aiding consistent fermentation performance; Biological Pathways: Involved in DNA replication, repair, and homologous recombination pathways.

Function: Synthesizes new DNA strands by adding nucleotides to a template strand during replication; Role in LAB: Ensures accurate DNA replication and genome stability, supporting growth and survival; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Maintains genetic integrity of LAB under stress, ensuring consistent fermentation and functionality in food products; Biological Pathways: Involved in DNA replication, base excision repair, nucleotide excision repair, mismatch repair, homologous recombination, and non-homologous end-joining.

Function: Transfers phosphate groups from ATP to specific substrates, regulating their activity; Role in LAB: Supports metabolic regulation, energy transfer, and signal transduction; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances LAB metabolic efficiency and adaptability during fermentation and stress conditions; Biological Pathways: Involved in general metabolic pathways and transferase-mediated phosphorylation processes.

Function: Catalyzes the interconversion of alcohols and aldehydes or ketones, facilitating the oxidation of alcohols to aldehydes or ketones and the reduction of aldehydes/ketones to alcohols; Role in LAB: Supports energy production and redox balance by metabolizing alcohols and aldehydes, contributing to growth, survival, and overall metabolic flexibility; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Helps LAB tolerate alcohol stress, contributes to flavor development during fermentation, and supports consistent metabolic activity in food products; Biological Pathways: Involved in Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis, Pyruvate metabolism, Fatty acid degradation, Tyrosine metabolism, Butanoate metabolism, and Carbon metabolism

Function: Synthesizes carbamoyl-phosphate from glutamine, bicarbonate, and ATP, providing a key precursor for the biosynthesis of arginine and pyrimidines; Role in LAB: Ensures the production of essential amino acids and nucleotides, supporting growth, protein synthesis, and genome maintenance; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Contributes to LAB metabolic robustness, aiding consistent fermentation, nutrient production, and overall functionality in food products; Biological Pathways: Involved in Arginine biosynthesis, Pyrimidine metabolism, Alanine, aspartate and glutamate metabolism

Function: Catalyzes the carboxylation of acetyl-CoA to malonyl-CoA, the first committed step in fatty acid biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Supports lipid biosynthesis for cell membrane formation and energy storage, contributing to growth and cellular integrity; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances LAB metabolic activity and robustness, influencing fermentation efficiency, flavor compound production, and overall food quality; Biological Pathways: Involved in Fatty acid biosynthesis, Pyruvate metabolism, Glyoxylate and dicarboxylate metabolism, Propanoate metabolism

Function: Catalyzes ATP hydrolysis to drive the transport of polar amino acids across the cell membrane; Role in LAB: Enables efficient uptake of essential amino acids for protein synthesis and metabolic functions, supporting growth in nutrient-limited environments; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Contributes to amino acid acquisition, enhancing stress tolerance and fermentation consistency in food products; Biological Pathways: Involved in ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transport and amino acid uptake pathways.

Function: Catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA by synthesizing RNA strands complementary to the DNA template; Role in LAB: Essential for gene expression and regulation, enabling synthesis of mRNA, tRNA, and rRNA necessary for cell growth and metabolic activity; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports active metabolism, stress adaptation, and protein synthesis during fermentation, ensuring consistent probiotic performance and product quality; Biological Pathways: Involved in transcription, RNA processing, nucleotide excision repair, and replication and repair pathways.

Function: Catalyzes the ATP-dependent alteration of DNA topology by introducing or removing supercoils, allowing DNA strands to unwind and rewind during replication and transcription; Role in LAB: Maintains DNA topology and genome stability, facilitating efficient replication, transcription, and segregation of chromosomes; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances genetic stability and stress resistance in LAB, promoting consistent fermentation and survival under processing conditions; Biological Pathways: Involved in DNA replication, repair, recombination, and chromosome segregation pathways.

Function: Catalyzes the reversible conversion of 3-phosphoglycerate to 2-phosphoglycerate in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis without requiring 2,3-bisphosphoglycerate; Role in LAB: Plays a key role in carbohydrate metabolism, enabling efficient energy production and metabolic flux during fermentation; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports energy generation and metabolic balance under diverse growth conditions, contributing to robust fermentation and flavor compound formation; Biological Pathways: Involved in glycolysis/gluconeogenesis, amino acid metabolism, carbon metabolism, and microbial metabolism in diverse environments.
